page.title: 17Leigh on Mendip description.
page.content: The village is a linear village set in farmland on the Mendip Hills at a height of about 180 metres. It has one main street running east to west along the north slope of a shallow valley. There is a small council estate to the south of the street and similar private housing to the north. The older houses are built of local limestone which, in many cases, has been cement rendered. At the extreme west end of the village is a recreation ground. The main road is about 1km to the south so there is little through traffic and only an occasional bus service. The only important local employment is in farming and the limestone quarrying industries.
